newsitem.title: UKRAINE: Ukraine to launch savings bond April 2-FinMin.
newsitem.headline: Ukraine to launch savings bond April 2-FinMin.

text.p: Ukraine plans to launch government bonds aimed mainly at individual savers in early April, the deputy Minister of Finance said on Thursday.

"In keeping with the government order which was signed on February 5, the volume of the first six-month issue of government bonds will be 50 million hrvynia and sales will begin at certain banks on April 2," Andriy Lytvyn said.
Volumes will grow if demand is high, he added.
"The nominal price of one bond will be 50 hryvnias and is aimed at citizens of Ukraine, but there is nothing stopping businesses or non-residents from buying the paper," he said.
Returns will equal the rate of inflation plus one percent.
The ministry's long-term plans foresee one- and two-year bonds being issued eventually, he added.
